707487f-b.text:
(1)
York Street, north side, at and east of Gold Street. At the corner was the William Purcel Tavern (1822). Here a Roman Catholic Church was organized danuary 7, 1822. Iu 1821, a priest from New York City, the Rev. Father Laracey said Mass in this Tavern.
1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(2)
The same, showing St. George's R.C. Lithuanian Church.
January 26, 1934.
(P. L. Sperr.
707487f-b.folder: York St. & Gold St., Brooklyn, NY

707486f-a.text:
York Street, at the N.W. corner of Gold Street, showing Goodwill Mission.
June 26, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
